Make Measure Databases

margot_create_database.Rd

This function provides a command-line interface for managing a database of longitudinal measures. It allows users to create, view, modify, and delete measures, as well as save and load measure databases.

Usage

margot_create_database(measures_path = NULL)

Arguments

measures_path

Character string. The path to the directory where measure databases are stored. If NULL (default), the current working directory is used.

Value

This function does not return a value. It runs an interactive command-line interface.

Details

The function provides the following main operations:

  • Create a new measures database

  • Open an existing measures database

  • List available .rds files in the specified directory

  • List measures in the current database

  • Add a new measure

  • Delete an existing measure

  • Modify an existing measure

  • Save the current measures data

  • Batch edit measures

Each measure in the database contains the following fields:

  • name: The name of the measure

  • items: A list of items or questions in the measure

  • description: A description of the measure

  • reference: A reference for the measure

  • waves: The waves in which the measure was used

  • keywords: Keywords associated with the measure

Note

This function uses a command-line interface and is designed to be run interactively. It uses local state management and does not modify global variables. Changes are only saved to disk when explicitly requested by the user.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
# Run the function with the default path (current working directory)
margot_create_database()

# Run the function with a specific path
margot_create_database("path/to/measures/directory")
} # }
